thread.title: Millions Still Without Power After East Coast Storm

author: Jon Kamp
title: Millions Still Without Power After East Coast Storm
text:
At least 2 million power customers across the Mid-Atlantic and Northeast U.S. were still in the dark early Saturday after a powerful, late winter storm toppled trees, pushed floodwaters into coastal communities and caused major travel headaches.
Falling trees and branches killed a 77-year-old woman in the Baltimore area, an 11-year-old boy in Putnam County, N.Y., and two people in Virginia, local authorities confirmed. There was also at least one storm-related death from falling trees or branches in both Rhode Island and Connecticut,...
